content.label: Amazing artwork, great storyline, overall an addicting, awesome game

First things first...THIS GAME AND ITS SEQUEL ARE WITHOUT A DOUBT, The top 5 Games you could get on this platform. Due to BS I‚Äôve bought this game and the second one twice...But it is MORE THAN WORTH IT! The story, the voice acting, the setting, the decision making (NOT BLACK AND WHITE AND BELIEVE ME YOU CANNOT PREDICT THE RESULTS OF YOUR CHOICES LIKE A MASS EFFECT STYLE GAME) There arnt enough compliments I can give this game (and BS2)  So summarizing....IF YOU LIKE TURN BASED STRATEGY, Fantasy, RPGs, Or Are looking for a good story...BUY THESE GAMES....YOU MOST CERTAINLY WILL NOT REGRET IT. Love and respect everyone. -Jim

title.label: No support for iPhone X display....

content.label: Can‚Äôt really enjoy the game with two ugly bars on both sides... please update üôèüèΩ

I loved the first Banner Saga and Banner Saga 2 is even better. I  was happy to see that they rebalanced the costs of promoting characters and also brought more functionality to features I pretty much ignored the first time around (e.g. Training tent). While the first installment was compelling because the world they built was so rich, I find the story more involving in the sequel. There's a mystery at the heart of the story and I'll certainly play BS3 so I can see how it all plays out. Thanks for a beautiful game!

title.label: A Stunning Game that Does Not Disapoint

content.label:
While it can be argued that the story in this game can be a little lagging compared to the first (some call it the middle story syndrome) it has a excess of lore and story that show how much the developers and community have put into this game. 
On the gameplay side it is incredible how the characters work. I have played through two times and found two teams consisting of mostly different characters who have unique stories and abilities to help you in your battles.
In the end the second Banner Saga is a real improvement that very few could have predicted how great it‚Äôs become.

Each frame is a work of art. Played this before banner saga one (on accident) and still loooooove this game. You form a close bond with every character, and it makes you really care what happens to them. Can‚Äôt wait for banner saga 3 in 2018

title.label: Fun, immersive and replayable - one of the great tactical RPGs

content.label: I play Banner Saga 2 on the iPad Air 2 and it runs great. The iPad is a great interface for this game. I love the continuity where characters built up from Banner Saga can pick right up in Banner Saga 2 (and into Banner Saga 3 when it comes out). Lots of variations to be tested and tried by varying and mixing combinations of characters, skills and items, especially in Survival Mode. Can't say enough good things about this game - one of my all-time favorites.
Gorgeous strategy game. It's outstanding.

First off, it's great to see a complex strategy game with simple mechanics.  The battles harken back to real chess like planning.  You have to be thinking several moves in advance.  Awesome stuff. 

Storytelling!  RPG!   It's all here.  Take on the role of the main character, but even good choices have consequences.  Betrayal, investigation, clan morale, and magic items are just a few of the wonderful things in this world that will engulf you.  

A+.  One of the best games ever, period...not just on my phone.
Freezing causes forced reload. Unfair. Usually happens after match. Otherwise a great game!
‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Great game that manages to outshine its predecessor
Better than the last one
A very cool game

title.label: Nice game, fizzles at the end

content.label: BS2 is a very good game. Beautiful and sometimes compelling story. Sadly this bloated multi gig footprint game ends with a fizzle and all too soon. I get that leaving folks wanting more can be a good thing, but wow that was so anti climatic. I thought I was no more than half way through when the ending credits rolled. That disappointment costs 2 stars for me.
Fun and entertaining while you are just chilling or flying and want something to occupy your time.

I really enjoy this game. The craft and love is visible in every frame. The music and VO are outstanding. The only knock is that on an iPhone it's tiny and sometimes have to use a magnifying glass to see the small wording.
Unplayable on an iPad 2
The second installment built in the first in amazing ways. I have fallen in love with this story all over again. Keep up the phenomenal work, Stoic studios!
This is game is absolutely amazing. Even better than the first one with new characters and awesome additions to battle tactics. The third installment can't come soon enough!

title.label: A great sequel in a great series

content.label: I've now played through Banner Saga 2 four times in order to see how the different choices affect the ending. A great dynamic, in a fantastic game with wonderful visuals and great storytelling. Looking forward to the third installment!

The art style and detail, the animation (wish there was more but I'll take what I can get), the music, the choices, the story, and battle mechanics are just breathtaking/unbelievable/awesome I cannot describe the awe I felt for the waterfall scene, to name one. It's worth it, every penny. I played it like 10 times as Rook and then I'm doing Alette now. The reason I didn't give this game 5 stars is because I DO NOT LIKE the food/morale system. Just because a day passed and there's less food doesn't mean that they should be dropping in morale! If there's no food or an event I get it but just the fact that a day passed? Anyway other that everything else is awesome. Game frequently crashes but whatever just a minor thing that will get fixed hopefully. GG

The decisions you make affect things way down the line. Engaging. Love the animation. 
Probably more fun on an iPad due to the smaller icons and text. 
But great game overall.

If you liked the first banner saga you will love this one. It's fundamentally the same just a little better in a lot of small ways. 

Oh, and I've spent hundreds of hours on survival mode. Great fix if you just want to fight!
The storytelling is fantastic. The gameplay keeps you coming back. Reminds me of choose your own adventure books where you reread to see what happens on each different path.
The Saga continues, and so does my fascination. Once again, Stoic delivers on its unique platform in the continuation of Banner Saga. I am excited for TBS3! Please continue your fantastic work!

*********

6/31/2017 - Text is still way too small even with the UI scale adjustment. This is rekated to my previous comment. If you click on a character and try to read the text it is very close to being unreadable, you seriously need a magnifying glass. I don't think this game is even playable on smaller devices. I have already sent feedback to the developer about this issue. I still cannot play the game because I cannot read the text.

*******

I have a iphone 7 plus. The text is way too small, borderline unreadable. Additionally the menu items are super tiny. Its really difficult to accurately click on menu items even after several attempts trying to press something. 

This game looks great and is probably fun but I am finding it unplayable due to the mentioned ui items.

title.label: Survival Mode crashes all the time

content.label:
Great game, great potential, but with awful flaws.
FTF, I am a big fan of the franchise, I have purchased both games and the survival mode. 
The music is sensational, the graphics is stunning, and the storyline is epic. Kudos to the developers.
BUT!
Survival Mode crashes all the time, the font and controls are too small on iPhone 6 Plus on the latest iOS. Will give a 5 star review once these problems are fixed.
Such a great game, but frequent crashing makes survival mode nigh impossible, because the game often counts the crash as one of your three allowed retries. PLEASE fix!
maybe the game is just not for me but the pace of play is slow and the amount of strategy action is small compared to the boring campaign management

Update May 4, 2017
Font still too small even with the update. I tried changing the font size in the setting and restart the game but the font size in the game is still the same small font. Can't play. Help!

Somehow after the update, the font size and the buttons become ridiculously small. I play on iPhone 6+ and it's too small to play. Hurts my eyes.

title.label: Great game but font size is frustrating.

content.label: On an iPad, I've selected the wrong dialogue choice a couple times now because the text font is very small. If the text is that small on an iPhone, I can imagine that it would be next to impossible. Hope they come out with an update soon to address the text sizing issue.

title.label: Great Game Which Needs Major Fixes

content.label:
I love Banner Saga and I love this game. Both of these should be five stars-- but there are two major fixes that need to be made:

1) the text in the game is small difficult to read-- occasionally even difficult to select! This is enormously harmful to a game which is driven by the written word and story. 

2) crashes before fights. I cannot tell you how often I've prepared for a fight to find the game kicked me out and I have to start my battle prep all over again. Or worse, I have to go back and remember what decisions I made before the battle. 

Please fix these things, Stoic! I want to love this completely lovable game! (And, also, I'm super pumped for Banner Saga 3!)

title.label: Latest update made font size too small!

content.label: Favorite game, amazing story, excellent gameplay.

Playing on an iPhone7+. I just finished the first game and was excited to continue onto the second. Unfortunately the UI and copy are too small to read. What's worse is that most story choices are presented on the bottom middle of the screen, which makes it difficult to tap accurately. In this sequel, the smaller text makes it nearly impossible without a tiny stylus. 

Please fix this for mobile-- desktop UI does not usually scale well into touch devices.

I was in love with the original game and was glad to see that this game made a great sequel. The combat has been improved and the story is still amazing. While it does bounce between the 2 caravans quite a bit I feel that the story is quite similar to a book in that sense, leaving cliff hangers after every chapter. If you enjoyed the first one you need to play this.

I really enjoyed "Banner Saga" and thoroughly anticipated the sequel and as soon as I seen it on the App Store I bought it, but imagine my disappointment when on day three of the story it crashes. Ok I can wait for an update, which took an incredibly long time by the way (although could have seemed like a long time with my excitement to play), and finally it comes: fixed frequent crashing on low memory devices. Yippee!! Alright let the Saga BEGIN! Day three: make decision, choose characters to send into battle, load screen, crash. Goodbye hopes and dreams. I deleted some larger app to make more storage room for the game and hard reset to no avail. I want to hold off on re-downloading the game because of its behemoth size, my storage says 3 G,and my internet is so slow but I will try that next.Please continue to work to fix crashing, I'm sure this is a Five star game and well worth the money: the visuals are beautiful, music just plain cool, dialogue interesting, and at least with the first Banner Saga story intriguing, and strategy a challenge , but for now I wait. Also tried just sending this to the support page but for some reason my email wouldn't go through so here I am. On newer devices I'm sure this game is great but if you have an older one perhaps hold off on getting this game.

Update: I wrote the above review maybe a week or two after the November 2016 update. This update to my review is now on February 11, 2017! Since then there have been absolutely no changes to the game. Come on guys it's been three months and I still can't play because it will always crash just before the waterfall (I only know there is a waterfall because before update that is how far I could make it without getting stuck because of crashing) what's the holdup. I see the other reviewers seem to enjoy the game but it seems not only myself but others have problems being able to play because of crashing. Let me be clear I believe this game will be fun, but right now I can't play it because it always crashes at one of the battles before the waterfall. Please fix crashing I paid for this game.

One of my favorite games on ipad. Deep story and gameplay. Worth multiple play throughs.

Survival mode crashes! Please fix it

I paid $5 and the program won't download. I have never had this problem before. The download circle sometimes moves slowly but after 15 minutes the download circle for this program is not moving at all. I see there is no way to contact the Apple App Store so I guess I'll just have to take this up with my credit card company. Great --I have nothing better to do.

This review is for the unplayable additional purchase ‚ÄúSurvival Mode‚Äù and not the main game and underlying game design, which are excellent.

 Survival mode is buggy and badly designed to the point of being unplayable. There are a number of problems but the biggest one is that the game is prone to crash while loading a level and every time it crashes you lose a ‚Äúreload‚Äù, up to the point where your game is over due to having no reload remaining. I have tried to play through the Normal and Hard difficulty campaigns on about 10 occasions and each time at least half of my reloads were used up by crashes and a crash ultimately ended the game, twice on the final battle. This is incredibly frustrating and has killed my desire to continue playing the game.

 I have tried a variety of things to avoid these crashes including: updating the app and OS, closing other apps before attempting to load a level, deleting photos and apps to ensure lots of memory is available on the phone, closing the app and reopening it between each level, etc. Nothing consistently works. 

 What‚Äôs really maddening is that this bug would not be that big of a problem if it weren‚Äôt for the limit on the number of battle reloads, which is completely unnecessary. Limiting reloads serves no discernable purpose within the game other than frustrating attempts to complete the higher difficulty campaigns. Particularly on ‚ÄúHard‚Äù some battles take time to strategize correctly but if too many attempts are made, you are forced to start over from the beginning. Defeating the game within a certain number of reloads should simply earn the player a ‚Äúbadge‚Äù rather than being a hard requirement.

In a related problem, the options for saving a game are very limited  and buggy as well. Your progress is only saved once a battle has been completed, automatically (usually), and only at that point.  You cannot save during a battle, which means that being interrupted for too long of a period will cause the app to quit and a reload to be lost. You cannot save after configuring players for a battle, which means that if you are forced to reload due to a defeat or crash you have to do all of the configuration again. Occasionally, the game does not automatically save and if you quit the app without ending the game internally you can potentially lose one or more battles worth or progress.

It should be possible to save the game at any point, utilizing the limited number of slots available to stop a battle in progress, save before configuring for the next battle, or save after configuring. Arguably this would make the game easier but it would also make it more playable and allow for different player and configuration options to be explored along the course of a single game, leading to more re-playability and, ultimately, more gameplay.

It‚Äôs unfortunate that the instability and bad design of the iOS version of this game makes it unplayable and, essentially, worthless as a separate purchase.

On my iPad 3 it seems like I spend five inured going through mostly boring/pointless dialogue, followed by a minute of Loading...
Don't see the point. 
Maybe it's better on faster iPads?  Hope so
Multiple crashing problems such that the game won't start. I'm reluctant to reload and start over.
It has crashed more times than I have completed a level in survival mode...
Still crashes ,, can't even get to first fight,, please fix,,, you can do it :)

Same great BS.

Poor controls at times, weirdly harder to use on iPhone 7+ than smaller ones.

Ends with a cliffhanger.

title.label: Awesome best game on the App Store and worth every cent

content.label:
The good: 
Gameplay is a great mix of challenging and fun. Combat is rewarding and well thought out. 
The challenges:
You have to make some tough choices when it comes to spending resources. There is not a huge abundance to spend you will need make sacrifices when it comes to keeping your caravan well stocked or leveling your combat characters.
Please come out with 3 already is my only complaint.

Love the game, and the add on, survival mode. But the constant crashes make it unplayable, as each crash removes one of your limited reloads, and eventually you can't continue the game. 

Stoic released an updated, but have not resolved the issue for the iPad Air 2.

Beautiful game but when I progress to the waterfall the game crashes. Two stars for game so far. But since I can't seem to even load the waterfall fight... I just can't continue, it just puts me at my home screen after it appears to be done loading. Very frustrated.

After finishing Banner Saga 1, I had to keep playing. This second game  lacks the fullness of the first Saga's character development and I'm finding it much harder to care about them (and their choices, and the plot) than the first time around. Dialogue seems comparably poorly written. I also find the video graphics unimpressive, and a sad break from the otherwise beautiful stills and pan shots.  Combat is more varied, however. Overall very playable but lacking the epic storytelling feel of the first.

As a game to play, I give it 3 stars.  And that's after the improvements they introduced over the original TBS.  The bad? You have to spend your currency to level up your characters. This means that you have to decide whether you want to feed your caravan or have better fighters.  There are a lot of really cool items that give your people really awesome buffs that I never bothered to purchase from the merchant because I needed food and leveled up heroes.  To be fair, maybe I'm missing something about how to gain more renown from battles than I did. The good?  The story, though based on Norse mythology, is still very original. Though I'm not a big fan of the battle system, I did enjoy the choose-your-own adventure style. The artwork is superb. The soundtrack and voice acting is world class.  Good enough to add a whole 'nother star to my review.
